alert.note: Alert for Kootenai; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 3:58PM MDT until June 11 at 5:34AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Kootenai and Shoshone. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coeur d`Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Rathdrum, Dalton Gardens, Hauser, Hayden Lake, Fourth Of July Pass, Fernan Lake Village, Huetter, Wolf Creek Campground, Beauty Creek Campground and Chilco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
